metadata.titel_preek: Easter Day & Easter Season: The Night and the Whirlwind

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Night/Death to rescue humanity from the 'cold clasp of death' and the 'tomb of hope' through the resurrection of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The rising sun revealed the victory already accomplished.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: Deliverance from Death/Dust and the gift of Eternal Life.
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
power to grant his divine life to all who come to him

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The Word of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the living Word of God, which is unique and trustworthy
God has revealed himself from a domain beyond the grave

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (represented by Mary, Thomas, and Job)
tekstueel_bewijs: to you and to me: 'Blessed are they who do not see and yet believe'
opened unto us the gate of everlasting life

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Wounds of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
the sign demanded by Thomas was to touch the marks of Jesus’s wounds

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Satan, Night, and the 'Tomb of Hope'
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the night in which Sin and Death reign.
Satan rules there. It is night.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but an ontological and cosmic reality (Death/Satan) that humans are powerless to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from doubt/despair to faith/confession.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (as Thomas/Job)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (faith) is a response triggered by the primary program (God's revelation/action).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He arose from the kingdom of Death.
The Lord God formed Adam from the dust.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: he must rise from the dead
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
God has a power that he cannot discern

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Being able to do' what man cannot. It is a theology of divine capacity vs. human incapacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) to ~S1 (Doubt/Dust) to ~S2 (Revelation) and finally S1 (Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's unilateral intrusion into the 'Night' of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Death is described as 'merciless' and 'irrevocable' to human effort.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are the bewildered beneficiaries of an action they did not initiate and could not conceive.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We have a real choice. We can choose a god who suits us...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
These little comforts are the best that we can do... before we, too, disappear.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary, Thomas, and Job are not models of virtue to emulate, but models of human 'dust' and 'doubt' who are met by God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God saves Job/Thomas despite their demands/doubts.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'making it happen' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; faith is a gift created by the Word.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly nested: God's cosmic victory (Program 1) enables the individual's transition from doubt to faith (Program 2).
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'choice' and the Spirit 'creating faith'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates the 'Pouvoir-croire' (ability to believe) where it was absent.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'reign of Death' and 'Night', a state of being rather than just a list of mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'Opponent' (Death) is sufficiently heavy to necessitate a Divine Subject.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Easter sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It avoids the trap of making faith a human 'work' by framing it as a response to a cosmic victory already won in the dark.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Night' imagery, Greimas reveals that 'Night' functions as a cosmic Opponent that defines the Subject's (God's) necessity.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Job/Thomas texts; Greimas shows they are structurally identical in their actantial roles as Receivers of Revelation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'comfort of being dust' is a modal shift from 'Vouloir-faire' (trying to survive) to 'Etre' (being) in the hands of the Sender.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively by making God the subject of the most critical verbs (overcame, raised, revealed, created).
